text: 73-4 When we look to the individuals of the same variety or sub-variety of our older cultivated plants and animals, one of the first points which strikes us, is, that they generally differ much more from each other, than do the individuals of any one species or variety in a state of nature. When nc bek s Mu inslinhuibs ef sume wryy v1 suff~ysw yf nur tliler cwlhiks gsw xu xninb5,muyf Hhe fiiT mou fum esch sMv1 Hin tho Hu msivihsb of smy m ypucies e1 rMrihy in s sM4tfmmhe
